name: Forensic Toxicology
description: This course will focus on topics in forensic toxicology. Lectures will include a review of pharmacokinetics, analytical techniques and quality assurance measures used in forensic toxicology, the effects of drugs on human performance and post-mortem toxicology of illicit drugs, pharmaceutical drugs and other poisons. The major focus of this course will be the role that a forensic toxicologist plays in criminal and death investigation. Tutorials will include case study exercises and mock court demonstrations with the possibility for field trips to court and forensic agencies in Ontario. [36L] (Priority given first to Forensic Science Specialists and Majors; then Minors)
